channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Tens of thousands of protesters gather in capital of Belarus for fourth week of daily demos
item.description: At least 100,000 rallied in Minsk on Sunday to demand the resignation of Lukashenko - the fourth week of protests since his dubious re-election on August 9.

item.title: PICTURED - Maga Martyr shot and killed in Portland
item.description: Disturbing video appears to show the moment Jay Bishop was gunned down in Portland on Saturday night. Witnesses said the victim had been macing people prior to the shooting.

item.title: Mum whose son has spent 'half of his life in coronavirus lockdown' pens open letter for parents
item.description: A Melbourne mother has written an honest open letter about the realities of being a mum to a one-year-old during the coronavirus lockdown, and it has struck a chord with parents around the world.

item.title: DOMINIC LAWSON: Now we've got the appetite back, we must all keep eating for Britain
item.description: DOMINIC LAWSON: Good luck getting into your favourite restaurant today, if you haven't booked long in advance. This Bank Holiday Monday is the final day of the Eat Out to Help Out scheme.

item.title: Ravers confront police trying to shut forest rave amid new crackdown on illegal parties
item.description: Crowds of police officers wearing helmets and hi-vis jackets moved in to break up the 'well-established and planned' all-night unlicensed music event in Thetford Forest.

item.title: Couple celebrates 60th anniversary with a photo shoot in their original wedding attire in Nebraska
item.description: Marvin and Lucille Stone celebrated their 60th anniversary by putting on their original wedding attire and posing for a special photo shoot in Kearney, Nebraska. The wedding dress was handcrafted.

item.title: New doc Love Fraud exposes prolific online dating con man Richard Scott Smith who scammed $1 million
item.description: New docuseries, Love Fraud exposes how Richard Smith, a serial con man bilked over $1 million from dozens of victims that he wooed into marriage - only to drain their accounts and vanish days later

item.title: BBC's new director-general Tim Davie is 'open' to replacing licence fee with subscription
item.description: Tim Davie has reportedly been told to come up with a viable funding model to replace the fee when he takes up his new role at the BBC's headquarters in London this week.

item.title: Adele shows off her VERY flat stomach in a halterneck bikini top after seven stone weight loss
item.description: In a picture shared to her Instagram, Adele wore her hair in Bantu knots leading some to slam the choice as 'insensitive'. The hairstyle is associated with people of African descent.

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS reviews the weekend's TV: Dr Finlay? A gent who could fix the corona crisis
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Children's Ward, written by Paul Abbott, was unearthed in the uproarious raid on telly archives that is Harry Hill's World Of TV (BBC2).

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn's brother Piers gets first £10,000 fine in London for illegal gatherings
item.description: Piers Corbyn, a 73-year-old meteorologist, led more than 10,000 anti-lockdown protesters who believe coronavirus is a hoax at a rally in Trafalgar Square on Saturday

item.title: Greek police treated Harry Maguire 'like just another drunk Brit'
item.description: The £85 million centre-half, 27, was last week found guilty of assaulting police and attempted bribery after officers arrived to break up a brawl outside a bar on the island of Mykonos.

item.title: 'Jihadi' textbook probe descends into farce after researchers analysed Israeli book promoting peace
item.description: Ministers promised urgent action after £120 million of UK foreign aid helped pay for schools in Gaza and the West Bank, where reading exercises for six-year-olds include the words 'martyr' and 'attack'.

item.title: Police widow backs call for new 'Harper's law' to give life terms to killers of emergency workers
item.description: Luke Haywood, 34, was jailed in 2014 for crashing into PC Gareth Browning in Reading while on day release from prison.

item.title: Plants can recognise their relatives, make decisions, and even COUNT, scientists say
item.description: For in the years since he was roundly mocked for saying he talked to plants - and that they 'responded' - evidence has grown that he may have been on to something.

item.title: Staff are pouring back to offices at a string of top firms as others try to lure workers to return
item.description: In a significant boost to the campaign to entice more office workers into city centres, many more companies said they had recorded an uptick in employees getting back to their desks.

item.title: Coleen Rooney 'finds Rebekah Vardy's strong-arm tactics' to rush libel case to court 'laughable'
item.description: Coleen Rooney has reportedly declared that she 'won't be bullied' by Rebekah Vardy when their libel case goes to court.

item.title: Bumblebees in urban areas are bigger and more hard-working than those in countryside, study shows
item.description: Scientists found they were about 4 per cent larger than their country cousins and reckon this is because they have to work harder to find food, travelling across roads which break up the green spaces.

item.title: Personal trainer Emily Skye, 35, shares a snap 10 weeks after giving birth
item.description: An Australian personal trainer has shared a photo of her body 10 weeks after giving birth to her second child, and has revealed the gym routine she's following to heal her ab separation and get stronger.

item.title: Almost 90% of teachers fear social distancing will be impossible when children return to school
item.description: A survey of 6,000 school staff found that teachers are suffering 'extreme anxiety' and more than a third felt the Government's approach to safety 'won't work' and will leave them 'at risk'.

item.title: Jared Kushner visits the Western Wall as he says 'the stage is set' for more Middle East peace
item.description: Jared Kushner visited the Western Wall in Jerusalem on Sunday, where it appeared he had a private time for prayer, after declaring the 'stage is set' for more Middle East peace deals.

item.title: Jockey Club chief executive steps down after investigation
item.description: Delia Bushell, 48, tendered her resignation last night.over allegations of bullying and racist comments. She claimed she was herself subject to 'unmerited, dishonourable, bullying behaviour'.

item.title: Number of people forced to sell their home to pay for nursing care to be counted for the first time
item.description: The Office for National Statistics declared it will find out the amount of people forced to sell their home to pay for their place in a care home. Estimates put the number between 40,000 and 70,000 a year.

item.title: Police recruit used force's computer to find out if her brother was in prison with officer
item.description: Naomi Jayne Buckland, from Newton Aycliffe in County Durham, acted out of 'misguided loyalty' to her brother Nathan, a court heard.

item.title: Gardening guru Alan Titchmarsh will go head-to-head with veteran journalist Andrew Marr
item.description: He will present Love Your Weekend on ITV at as the journalist's self-titled programme interviewing political heavyweights airs at 9am on BBC1.The show is being compared with the BBC's Countryfile.

item.title: The Britain's Got Talent 2020 finalists are revealed!
item.description: The final 40 Britain's Got Talent acts have been unveiled, after viewers were forced to wait an unusually lengthy four months to find out who was through to the 2020 semi-finals.

item.title: MARK MASON reveals the weird and wonderfully colourful phrases other nations favour
item.description: When it's 'raining chair legs', as the Greeks say, don't you wish you were 'snug as a cockerel in pastry' - as the French call a bug who's toasty in a rug?

item.title: Captain TOM MOORE recalls the warning he received before riding off in the Burmese jungle
item.description: CAPTAIN TOM MOORE: When I went off to war in 1940, my 81-year-old grandmother told my mother, 'Don't worry about our Tom. I'll be looking after him from heaven.'

item.title: Rebel Wilson reveals her exact weight as she kicks goals during her 'year of health'
item.description: It's the question everyone's been asking - just how much does Rebel Wilson weigh?

item.title: Farmer fits his fleet of vehicles with solar panels to power the freezers
item.description: Ice cream maker David Baker said he disliked seeing fumes billowing from his stationary vans because the engine had to be on for the machinery to work.So he fitted three of his vans with solar panels.

item.title: Rip-off firms face crackdown as Government plans to outlaw bullying tactics
item.description: The Government is proposing new laws to stop parking 'cowboys' using aggressive tactics on motorists, while it also plots a ban on cars parking on pavements in England.

item.title: Devout Shiite Muslims mark day of Ashura in Iraqi holy city of Najaf
item.description: *GRAPHIC CONTENT* Shiite pilgrims were left covered in blood as they struck themselves with swords during the procession to mark the day of Ashura.

item.title: Portugal on the brink of being added back onto quarantine list and needs drop in number of cases
item.description: On Friday, Portugal reported its highest new daily virus figure for seven weeks, with 401 cases detected and is now an 'amber' nation, meaning it is approaching the UK threshold for quarantine.

item.title: RAF Typhoon jets intercept Ryanair jet at Stansted after 'suspicious object' found in plane toilet
item.description: A 34-year-old man from Kuwait and a 48-year-old man from Italy were detained at the London airport, Essex Police confirmed.

item.title: Plastic bag tax is set to DOUBLE: Price of a single-use carrier will rise to 10p
item.description: Ministers are set to double the cost of 5p carrier bags and extend the charge to include small shops, markets and takeaways from next April.

item.title: Super-scan spots heart problems in women faster
item.description: Doctors often miss female cardiac issues because they do not show up like those suffered by men. But a new scan displays the unique differences in women's hearts, particularly in older age.

item.title: Man is caught on camera 'attempting to rape' a woman, 25, on NYC subway platform
item.description: Jose Reyes of New York City was arrested on Sunday afternoon by the NYPD after he was caught on camera attempting to rape a 25-year-old woman on an Upper East Side subway platform

item.title: Hospitals in UK record another three coronavirus deaths with all fatalities in England
item.description: Another 1,715 people have tested positive for coronavirus today. The last time Britain's daily case load was this high was on June 4, when 1,805 people were diagnosed in just 24 hours.

item.title: Pupils could be sent home for joke COUGHING
item.description: As many schools in England prepare to reopen tomorrow, strict new behaviour policies have been introduced to enforce social distancing requirements.

item.title: Care homes in England bore the brunt of UK coronavirus deaths, new figures show
item.description: Over the first 16 weeks of the outbreak, there were 79 per cent more deaths in care homes than seen on average in the previous five years in England. That compared with rises of 62 per cent in Scotland.

item.title: Meet the women who say baring all is a natural stress-buster
item.description: Research conducted in 2017 by psychologists at Goldsmiths, University of London, found that those who spent time naked liked their bodies more and were more satisfied with their lives.

item.title: Mother left furious after deaf daughter, eight, 'turned away' from shop for not wearing a face mask
item.description: Julie Muller, 41, and her daughter Sadie-Grace, were stopped at Cotswold Outdoor shop in Newcastle for not wearing a mask, but she is exempt because they communicate through lip reading.

item.title: Hundreds of travellers descend on village for annual horse fair
item.description: A huge crowd of partygoers breached social distancing rules and live-streamed their celebration on Facebook, leading Northamptonshire locals to condemn their 'bare-faced cheek'.

item.title: Joan Collins? Spiky! Raquel Welch? Difficult! The beauty guru who's seen the true face of Hollywood
item.description: Bobbe Joy, 75, Beverly Hills make-up artist to the stars, recalls her various 'difficult' and 'challenging' clientele. After five decades in the business her memoir is causing something of a stir.

item.title: Rishi Sunak's £30bn tax raid: He is warned not to hammer middle classes to pay off coronavirus bill
item.description: The Chancellor is said to be considering a huge fiscal raid in this autumn's Budget to plug the gaping hole in public finances after record spending on coronavirus.

item.title: Boris Johnson 'tries to recruit Riz Lateef to front government's daily press conferences'
item.description: Riz Lateef is the prime minister's top choice for the job from 9 Downing Street, according to senior Tory sources, which comes with a salary of at least £100,000.

item.title: Mutated coronavirus strain '10 times more infectious' but less deadly is discovered in Indonesia
item.description: Indonesia reported 2,858 new infections on Sunday, below the previous day's record of 3,308 but above the past month's daily average, data by the health ministry showed.

item.title: Black Panther director Ryan Coogler pays tribute to the late Chadwick Boseman
item.description: The Black Panther director remembered being awed at Chadwick Boseman's ability to read lines in Xhosa on the set of Captain America: Civil War, which made he determined to direct him.

item.title: Indian restaurant in Bradford closes after seven staff test positive for Covid-19
item.description: The cases at the popular Akbar's restaurant came in a short three-week window, with the last known case reported on August 20. The restaurant owners decided to shut down entirely for five days.

item.title: Unilever boss was forced to quit after his secret affair with a female colleague was exposed
item.description: Gary McGaghey, finance chief for a project with Pepsi, was forced to resign after Andrea Pirie (pictured), another Unilever director, exposed his affair with a female colleague.

item.title: Race for coronavirus vaccine could risk making the pandemic WORSE
item.description: Experts advising the WHO say that an ineffective vaccine is worse than no vaccine at all as it would make people complacent. An Oxford scientist also hit out at the 'capitalistic' race to find a cure.

item.title: Man, 22, is charged with theft of Thames Clipper boat
item.description: Joseph Hawkridge - from Chatham, Kent - was charged with taking a conveyance without the owner's consent and will appear in Thames Magistrates' Court on Monday.

item.title: Would you pay £8 for water that's full of bacteria?
item.description: Water kefir is a fermented drink made from combining water, sugar and kefir 'grain' cultures - so called because these live organisms resemble grains.

item.title: University union under fire for claiming campuses 'may be care homes' of second coronavirus wave
item.description: University and College Union has been accused of spreading panic as general secretary Dr Jo Grady claimed universities could become 'the care homes' of a second coronavirus wave.

item.title: Escape from New York: Wealthy Big Apple residents flee the city and move out to the suburbs
item.description: New York City residents with cash are fleeing the Big Apple in droves and moving to nearby suburbs as the pandemic has enabled them to work from home while Manhattan office buildings stay empty.

item.title: MATTHEW SYED: Why we must stop mollycoddling our children
item.description: Journalist and author Matthew Syed argues we need to change the negative tone of the coronavirus pandemic in the week that children return to school.

item.title: Targeting the wealth creators to pay coronavirus bill would be madness, writes ALEX BRUMMER
item.description: ALEX BRUMMER: With a Budget looming this autumn and Britain's national debt standing at extraordinary levels, it will come as no surprise that the Treasury is dusting off plans for big tax rises.

item.title: EastEnders' Gillian Taylforth is seen out for the first time since her ex-fiancé was shot
item.description: The actress, 65, who is best known for playing Kathy Beale in EastEnders, was photographed sitting in the passenger side of a car, while in Hertfordshire, last weekend

item.title: How to dress like a grown up with Shane Watson: Jacket and jeans, the reboot
item.description: Shane Watson took inspiration from Kate Moss, Rosie Huntington-Whiteley and Meghan Markle for styling the eternally trendy jacket and jeans combination, flattering at any age.

item.title: How couple's £90-a-night bed and breakfast sparked nightmare dispute neighbours on the private road
item.description: Steve Marcham and Diana Groves turned their £1million home in Ringwood, Hampshire, into a £90-a-night bed and breakfast. But neighbours have launched legal action to shut down the B&B.

item.title: Shh! Anti-agers no one but you need to know about: Can any creams cure the dark patches on my face?
item.description: An anonymous reader told British beauty expert Inge van Lotringen they developed melasma during lockdown and wanted to know if they can use any creams to minimise discolouration.

item.title: Colder than Christmas! Beaches are set to be deserted on Bank Holiday Monday
item.description: It will be the coldest August Bank Holiday for 50 years and 15C (59F) colder than last year's record hottest of 33.2C (92F).

item.title: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Why won't you let your heroine strike back, JK?
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: Tom Burke barely has to act as moody private investigator Cormoran Strike: He just stomps around with a scowl, lighting cigarettes and grunting.

item.title: Elsa McAlonan's Beauty Upgrades: How to keep your skin glowing
item.description: Elsa McAlonan reveals a selection of the best highlighter sticks and powders to maintain our glowing skin as we say goodbye to August.

item.title: Four-day-old baby's death could have been avoided if she was born half an hour earlier
item.description: Becca Janes was plagued by guilt after her baby Hallie-Rae died at four days old. But she later learned the tragedy at William Harvey Hospital in Ashford, Kent, could have been avoided.

item.title: India and Russia both get gold medals at chess championship
item.description: Nihal Sarin, 16, and Divya Deshmukh, 14, lost connection due to 'a global internet outage' in the last round of the Chess Olympiad. The competition was held online this year.

item.title: Spaniel Max who delighted Kate Middleton could get own STATUE after raising £100k for animal charity
item.description: The 13-year-old springer Max, of Keswick, Cumbria, has been put forward for the public tribute after helping to raise £100,000 for the PDSA in six weeks. Owner Kerry Irving said he is his biggest fan.

item.title: The one lesson I've learned from life: Luke Goss says we MUST embrace new beginnings
item.description: Born in South London, Luke Goss, 51, found fame with his twin, Matt, in Eighties pop band Bros. After Bros split acrimoniously in 1992, he moved with wife Shirley to LA to act.

item.title: Why working from home might not be as good for you as you think, says a startling new book
item.description: With the market for 'rent-a-friend' on the up and three in five 18-to-34-year-olds admitting they are often or sometimes lonely author Noreena Hertz reveals the ways we can combat this in everyday life.

item.title: Steph & Dom solve your sex, love & life troubles: We were caught off guard by our son coming out
item.description: An anonymous couple struggled to digest the news that their eldest son is gay. They ask Steph and Dom Parker, 53 and 55, how they can repair the damage after their delayed reaction.

item.title: This is what 53 looks like: Mother says virtual workouts and hi-tech lip balm keep her youthful
item.description: Dr Sabrina Shah, a plastic surgeon who lives in London with husband Divyesh and their two children, reveals having botox twice a year and facials once a month help maintain her youth.

item.title: Mum's mad mission to find me a father: Filmmaker SARAH ASPINALL describes mother's globa search
item.description: After her father died when she was six Sarah Aspinall's mother Audrey started to search for a new partner who could be a father figure to Sarah. The search took them around the globe for years.

item.title: My lightbulb moment: Beauty innovator Valerie Obaze reveals the inspiration behind skincare brand
item.description: Valerie Obaze, 40, lives in London with her husband and three children. She revealed that the lack of shea oil available on the market prompted her to start her brand R&R Luxury in 2010.

item.title: Barclays boss Jes Staley facing fresh calls to resign
item.description: Authorities in the US Virgin Islands have ordered JP Morgan, Staley's former employer, to hand over the banker's communications with paedophile Epstein.

item.title: Top firms cut 250,000 jobs in five months of coronavirus
item.description: Gatwick Airport, sandwich chain Pret a Manger and BMW Mini became the latest to swing the jobs axe last week, meaning around 255,000 roles have been cut or marked for the chop since March.

item.title: Two St. Louis cops are shot before gunman forces family out of home and barricades himself inside
item.description: One police officer is in a critical condition after being shot in the head while responding to a report of a shooting in the south side of St. Louis. Another officer was shot in the leg.

item.title: Photos show devastation in riot-torn Kenosha as Trump prepares to visit
item.description: Stunning images show razed buildings, charred cars and debris-littered streets in Kenosha, Wisconsin, after a week of unrest following the police shooting of Jacob Blake.

item.title: Benoit Paire provides coronavirus scare for the US Open after testing positive
item.description: MIKE DICKSON: Several of his compatriots, such as Richard Gasquet, were immediately told to confine themselves to their hotel rooms after the test was discovered.

item.title: Brawl breaks out in Glasgow beer garden as drunk thugs throw punches and ice bucket across a table
item.description: Punches were thrown and an ice bucket hurled across a table at the Sanctuary nightclub's beer garden yesterday in Glasgow after a mass brawl broke out leaving bystanders screaming.

item.title: Dozens of activists gather in Notting Hill for Million People March in BLM protest
item.description: Dozens of Black Lives Matter protesters have gathered outside Notting Hill tube station in west London for a demonstration.

item.title: Los Angeles teacher flees home due to death threats for wearing 'I Can't Breathe' T-shirt
item.description: A Los Angeles English teacher was forced to flee her home after receiving death threats for wearing an 'I Can't Breathe' T-shirt during virtual class.

item.title: Glastonbury WILL return next June, organisers say - but it's sold out as few buyers asked for refund
item.description: Glastonbury co-organiser Emily Eavis said they have 'no plans' to move the event from June to September 2021. Founder Michael Eavis previously said the 2021 event was 'wishful thinking'.

item.title: Wildfire forces over 3,100 to evacuate in Spain's Andalusia
item.description: The blaze started in the mountains near the town of Almonaster la Real, 120 kilometers (75 miles) northwest of the city of Seville and has already scorched 100 square kilometers of land.
item.media:description: Wildfires advance in Almonaster la Real in Huelva, Spain, Thursday Aug. 27, 2020. Hundreds of people were evacuated and thousands of hectares have already burned in a wildfire that began on Thursday in the southern region of Andalusia, in Huelva. (A.Perez, Europa Press via AP)

item.title: Girl, 16, 'is raped' in Liverpool city centre hotel
item.description: Police rushed to an apartment inside the Uno building on Temple Court, Liverpool at around 4.30am today after the alleged attack took place.

item.title: Lara Trump: Donald Trump wants to meet with Jacob Blake's family when he visits Kenosha on Tuesday
item.description: Donald Trump has reached out to Jacob Blake's family and is trying to set up a meeting with them during his visit to Kenosha, Wisconsin on Tuesday following the police shooting last week.

item.title: Prince Harry its impossible to find rugby balls in the US for Archie
item.description: The Duke of Sussex , 35, said he is 'loving' life in the states in a new clip released of a video call with the Rugby Football League. The royal spoke from his $14 million mansion in Santa Barbara.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton dedicates Belgian GP win to late Black Panther actor Chadwick Boseman
item.description: The esteemed star died this weekend aged just 43 after a tragic, and secretive, battle with colon cancer - and Hamilton has joined a flood of high-profile sports stars to have penned heartfelt respects.

item.title: NHS worker under investigation after she claimed coronavirus is 'a load of b*****ks'
item.description: Care UK employee Louise Hampton recorded a video criticising a certificate she had been given thanking her for 'making a difference to patients' amid the virus outbreak.

item.title: Lloyd's of London reopens with temperature scanner and ban on inside dining
item.description: Lloyd's of London will welcome staff back to its grand offices on September 1 with a variety of safety measures in place - including social distancing floor markers and antibacterial misting.

item.title: Violent drug cartel is using BOMB-equipped drones to assassinate enemies in Mexico
item.description: A Mexican drug cartel known as the Cártel de Jalisco Nueva Generación (CJNG) has been linked to a number of drone devices equipped with small explosives this year in Tepalcatepec, Michoacan.

item.title: ALL passengers on board TUI flight from Zante to Cardiff are told to self-isolate
item.description: Passengers who were on TUI flight 6215 from Zante to Cardiff on Tuesday are now being considered as 'close contacts' of those who tested positive for COVID-19.

item.title: Fury in Germany as far-right protesters storm parliament building
item.description: Hundreds of protesters breached a security barrier and raced up the steps outside Berlin's parliament building late on Saturday before being stopped and dispersed by police.

item.title: Brad Pitt, 56, braves the rain in Paris as he leaves hotel without girlfriend Nicole Poturalski, 27
item.description: Brad Pitt braved the Paris rain on Sunday, snapped heading to a waiting car.

item.title: Chadwick Boseman's posthumous tweet makes history as the most 'liked' post in Twitter history
item.description: Chadwick Boseman, 43, passed on Friday August 29 after his secret four year battle with colon cancer. The tweet announcing his passing is the most liked tweet in the site's history.

item.title: Terrifying moment three-year-old girl whisked 100 feet into air by giant kite at Taiwanese festival
item.description: A three-year-old girl was caught up by a giant orange kite and lifted up from the ground. The youngster was out at a kite festival in Nanliao, Taiwan, earlier today when the shocking video was taken.

item.title: British Library's chief librarian says 'racism is the creation of white people'
item.description: Liz Jolly, who has been the institution's chief librarian since 2018, is urging white members of staff at the British Library to support the Anti Racism action plan as the institution addresses 'colonial origins'

item.title: Son of Fleetwood Mac's Peter Green son reveals he was forced to go to the High Court for a DNA test
item.description: The secret son of late Fleetwood Mac legend Peter Green has revealed he went to court for a DNA test to prove his paternity, after the rocker refused to acknowledge him.

item.title: Former PM David Cameron joins hoards of tourists on chilly beach in Cornwall
item.description: Former Prime Minister David Cameron, 53, was spotted on Thursday wearing a shortie wetsuit and taking to the waves at Polzeath. He was carrying a bodyboard as he strolled the beach

item.title: Madeleine McCann prime suspect Christian Brueckner 'is linked to 25 burglaries' in Praia da Luz
item.description: Christian Brueckner, the prime suspect in the disappearance of Madeleine McCann, was linked to more than two dozen burglaries on holiday homes in the resort of Praia da Luz.

item.title: Woman who 'caught husband having sex with his mother' says she suspected something between them
item.description: Lori Lavoie (seen left with her husband, Tony Lavoie, 43) of Fitchburg, Massachusetts, told police that she long suspected her husband was having sex with his mother, Cheryl Lavoie (right), 64.

item.title: Tenant staying in house rent-free amid eviction ban says he will be forced to live 'on the street'
item.description: Emma and Russell Burton, 41, are living with her parents in France after the tenant at their Merseyside home stopped paying rent and refused to leave.

item.title: Mass use of hand gels to control Covid risks creating superbug 'armageddon', researchers warn
item.description: Dr Andrew Kemp, of the University of Lincoln, has said that the overuse of alcohol-based hand gels during the pandemic will allow other bacteria and viruses on our hands to adapt and survive gel use

item.title: Auckland's Stage Three lockdown will end and be replaced by 'level 2.5' from Monday
item.description: From 11.59pm on Sunday, restrictions in New Zealand's most populous city will be eased after two-and-a-half weeks to a Stage Two warning, like the rest of the nation.

item.title: Global coronavirus cases hits 25 million as India sets grim record with 78,761
item.description: The US leads the count with 5.9 million cases, according to John Hopkins University, followed by Brazil with 3.8 million and India with 3.5 million. Actual number is thought to be significantly higher.

item.title: Husband devastated by the death of his wife of 52 years takes his final breath just 16 hours later
item.description: Paul Worsley suffered a fatal heart attack the day after he said goodbye to his wife of 52 years, Delma, when she died from complications following surgery in New Zealand.

item.title: A quack getaway! Amazing moment daredevil duck races car down M23 motorway at 60mph
item.description: A duck was seen joining the M23 near Gatwick Airport before dodging a black van and settling into the outside lane of the motorway, keeping pace with the flow of traffic at 60mph.

item.title: Notting Hill streets that would be bustling with revellers lie deserted after carnival was cancelled
item.description: While usually the streets of west London are bustling with musicians, live performances and revellers, this year the streets are deserted as the festival has moved online due to the pandemic.

item.title: Up to 200 leather-clad sex fetish fans around the world cavort on annual S&M river cruise in Germany
item.description: Typically, 600 passengers would board the 'Torture Ship' in Germany, but no more than 250 people were allowed to take part this year amid the worldwide Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Russian Su-27 fighter jet cuts in front of US B-52 bomber in 'unsafe and unprofessional' intercept
item.description: The Pentagon released video of a Russian Su-27 fighter jet veering directly into the path of an American B-52 bomber as it conducted 'routine operations over the Black Sea on Friday morning.

item.title: Owners of beach huts worth £300,000 angered by council's bid to build two-storey restaurant
item.description: Officials at the council tabled the £1million scheme for Mudeford Spit, Dorset, on the site of a cafe that burned down two years ago. Residents have ordered the council to 'take notice of our feelings'

item.title: New BBC boss 'considering reversing decision not to sing Rule Britannia! at Proms' insiders say
item.description: Tim Davie, who takes over on Tuesday, is understood to believe his predecessor Lord Tony Hall's move wreaked 'terrible damage' to the BBC, insiders have said as anger mounts about the decision.

item.title: BBC's new director-general 'will clamp down on presenters making money by hosting corporate events'
item.description: The reported move is thought to be part of Tim Davie's vision of putting impartiality back at the heart of what the BBC does and ensure it is worthy of the £157.50 compulsory licence fee.

item.title: Comedian Andy Hamilton is publishing a 349-page novel written entirely by HAND over two years
item.description: Andy Hamilton (pictured) estimates he handwrote 3,000 pages including the revisions and got through 43 Berol Italic pens. Longhand is due to be released on Thursday.

item.title: Serial killer 'prime suspect' who may have been targeting elderly couples since 90s is NAMED
item.description: A senior coroner's officer published a report claiming there were significant similarities between the deaths of couples across North West England between 1996 and 2011.

item.title: Hate preacher Abu Hamza is suing US authorities over 'cruel and degrading' conditions in prison
item.description: Hamza, the former imam of north London's Finsbury Park mosque, says he isn't getting enough sunlight in his cell - and being deprived of his hooks means he has to tear open packets of food with teeth.

item.title: Jessica Mulroney DELETES sweet throwback shot of her son and Meghan Markle
item.description: Stylist Jessica Mulroney, 40, from Canada, first shared the sweet image of Meghan Markle, 39, with her son Brian, now ten, on Instagram on Thursday but has since deleted the snap.

item.title: Home Secretary Priti Patel comes under fire as deportations crash to their lowest level EVER
item.description: Figures show that the number of illegal immigrants, visa overstayers and foreign criminals leaving the UK fell by an astonishing 34 per cent last year.

item.title: How a Sydney wine detective tried to buy Stalin's personal cellar after it was hidden for 60 years
item.description: Two decades ago John Baker got a tip about a mythical wine collection said to have been assembled by the last tsar of Russia, and later fallen into the hands of Soviet dictator Josef Stalin.

item.title: Pablo Escobar's son brands British painter claiming to be the drug lord's secret child 'a crazy guy'
item.description: Sebastian Marroquin (pictured), 43, says that Phillip Witcomb, 55, is 'the third guy in the world who claims to be the first-born' son of Pablo Escobar.

item.title: Toddler is left with serious head injuries after falling from car into road
item.description: Officers were called around 3pm yesterday to reports of an incident at the junction of Eastgate and the exit to Eastgate Retail Park, in Accrington, Lancashire.

item.title: Man hunted for attempted murder after stabbing young mother out walking with her five-year-old son
item.description: A mother, 24, was walking with her son in Withington, south Manchester, when a man approached her with a knife and stabbed her in a 'vicious and unprovoked attack'.

item.title: Celebrity hair stylist launches legal battle to keep $31,000 sheepskin CHAIR after 'sham wedding'
item.description: William Jordan Blackmore, 37, tied the knot to longtime girlfriend Andi Potamkin, 31, in a star-studded ceremony back in 2015, only to learn three years later that they were not legally wed.

item.title: Adele stuns fan by responding to his social media message
item.description: The Hello hitmaker, 32, left Colyn, who runs an Adele fan account, stunned as he admitted he was 'bawling his eyes out' over the response.

item.title: Rescuers lift 209 migrants to safety from Banksy's rescue boat
item.description: Some 209 migrants were transferred from the MV Louise Michel on to another rescue boat, after its crew put out a series of mayday alerts saying the vessel could not move due to an overcrowded deck.

item.title: Rebel Wilson shows off her staggering weight loss after already dropping 18kg
item.description: The 40-year-old stunned her fans when she showed off her slimmed-down physique in a tight blue wrap dress on Instagram.

item.title: Alan Carr shows off his lockdown weight loss after being inspired by pal Adele shedding seven stone
item.description: The comedian, 44, took to Instagram and shared a snap of himself showing off his chiselled jawline, with many users commenting on his look.

item.title: The guru who got Adele back on track: Glennon Doyle is a top self-help author adored by the stars
item.description: One is an icon whose searingly honest writing has earned her millions, who's weathered a high-profile divorce, spoken candidly about post-partum blues and gone through a reinvention.
